review: It worked on my very powerful Dell Inspiron 9400 laptop, once.  I could cast all screens to my Sony HD.  I did not put it to full use until a month later.  Google changed their specs.  I can only get full HD on their "approved " providers, and only on my gaming desktop.  It will not work on Amazon Prime, or any device with the Android operating system. It is totally controlled by Chrome operating system and their software that Google may change at will.  I will not accept my content to be censored by Google for any reason.  There are much better ways to display streaming content on the HD TV of your choice.

review: I bought this little device so I could "cast" my Chrome browser tabs onto my TV screen from my tablet & phone (Transformer Infinity tablet).  Based on the documentation, casting Chrome tabs was one of the main selling points and it says it fully supports Android & Chrome.  However, what they don't mention is that you can only cast browser tabs from the "desktop" version of Chrome.There is currently no Chromecast extension for the mobile version of Chrome...  which basically means you can't cast Chrome tabs from your tablet or phone.From a desktop/laptop computer you CAN cast Chrome tabs (since this isn't the mobile version of Chrome).  This seemed to work good.  However, tablet casting was my main intention and in this category it's very limit (from tablet, you can only use Netflix, Youtube, and Google Play/Music.... that's it...)I guess I'll just have to wait until Chrome mobile support is added...
